title: What childhood diseases have been eradicated? - Quora

response.answer_text: None! There’s not one disease or illness that’s been eradicated! What does that tell you? It’s a sobering statement on humanity and humans as a whole! Simple fact is there’s nothing man has been able to do to completely end any of the threats to humans! It goes in waves! In recent years there has been the birth of superbugs that are drug and treatment resistant! Say hello to the newest one! Trust me this one is one for the record books!

Short answer: with one human and one animal exceptions, Dr. Drude is correct. Longer answer: the human disease Smallpox Smallpox - Wikipedia and the bovine disease Rinderpest Rinderpest - Wikipedia have both been eradicated from the wild. We are close to eliminating polio, or were, until civil unrest occurred in the two remaining pockets of endemic disease.
